annotations.description:
Extra annotations for all generated resources. Most manifest types have a more specific annotations value
associated with them.
annotations.title: annotations

appNameOverride.description: (string) The app name override for this deployment.
appNameOverride.title: appNameOverride

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the Certificates Secret manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

existingSecret.description: Name of an existing Secret manifest to mount which contains trusted certificates.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

labels.description: Extra labels for the Certificates Secret manifest.
labels.title: labels

values.description: List of secret name value pairs to include in this Secret manifest.
values.title: values

default_policy.description:
Default policy can either be 'bypass', 'one_factor', 'two_factor' or 'deny'. It is the policy applied to any
resource if there is no policy to be applied to the user.
default_policy.title: default_policy

secret.description: # Configure the ACL as a Secret instead of part of the ConfigMap.

enabled.description: Enables the ACL section being generated as a secret.
enabled.title: enabled

existingSecret.description: An existingSecret name, if configured this will force the secret to be mounted using the key above.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

key.description: The key in the secret which contains the file to mount.
key.title: key

secret.title: secret

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the ConfigMap manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

extra_attributes.description:
The extra attributes to load from the directory server. These extra attributes can be used in other areas of
Authelia such as OpenID Connect 1.0. Itâ€™s also recommended to check out the Attributes Reference Guide for more
information.
extra_attributes.title: extra_attributes

algorithm.description: Controls the hashing algorithm used for hashing new passwords.
algorithm.title: algorithm

iterations.description: Controls the number of iterations when hashing passwords using Argon2.
iterations.title: iterations

key_length.description: Controls the output key length when hashing passwords using Argon2.
key_length.title: key_length

memory.description: Controls the amount of memory in kibibytes when hashing passwords using Argon2.
memory.title: memory

parallelism.description: Controls the parallelism factor when hashing passwords using Argon2.
parallelism.title: parallelism

salt_length.description: Controls the output salt length when hashing passwords using Argon2
salt_length.title: salt_length

variant.description:
Controls the variant when hashing passwords using Argon2. Recommended argon2id. Permitted values
argon2id, argon2i, argon2d.
variant.title: variant

cost.description: Controls the hashing cost when hashing passwords using Bcrypt.
cost.title: cost

variant.description:
Controls the variant when hashing passwords using Bcrypt. Recommended standard. Permitted values
standard, sha256.
variant.title: variant

iterations.description: Controls the number of iterations when hashing passwords using PBKDF2.
iterations.title: iterations

salt_length.description: Controls the output salt length when hashing passwords using PBKDF2.
salt_length.title: salt_length

variant.description:
Controls the variant when hashing passwords using PBKDF2. Recommended sha512. Permitted values sha1,
sha224, sha256, sha384, sha512.
variant.title: variant

block_size.description: Controls the block size when hashing passwords using Scrypt.
block_size.title: block_size

iterations.description: Controls the number of iterations when hashing passwords using Scrypt.
iterations.title: iterations

key_length.description: Controls the output key length when hashing passwords using Scrypt.
key_length.title: key_length

parallelism.description: Controls the parallelism factor when hashing passwords using Scrypt.
parallelism.title: parallelism

salt_length.description: Controls the output salt length when hashing passwords using Scrypt.
salt_length.title: salt_length

variant.description: Controls the variant when hashing passwords using Scrypt. Permitted values scrypt, yescrypt.
variant.title: variant

iterations.description: Controls the number of iterations when hashing passwords using SHA2 Crypt.
iterations.title: iterations

salt_length.description: Controls the output salt length when hashing passwords using SHA2 Crypt.
salt_length.title: salt_length

variant.description:
Controls the variant when hashing passwords using SHA2 Crypt. Recommended sha512. Permitted values
sha256, sha512.
variant.title: variant

path.description: The path to the file with the user details list.
path.title: path

case_insensitive.description:
Enabling this search option allows users to login with their username regardless of case. If enabled users
must only have lowercase usernames.
case_insensitive.title: case_insensitive

email.description:
Allows users to login using their email address. If enabled two users must not have the same emails and
their usernames must not be an email.
email.title: email

watch.description: Enables reloading the database by watching it for changes.
watch.title: watch

additional_groups_dn.description: An additional dn to define the scope of groups.
additional_groups_dn.title: additional_groups_dn

additional_users_dn.description: An additional dn to define the scope to all users.
additional_users_dn.title: additional_users_dn

address.description:
The address for the ldap server. Format: <scheme>://<address>[:<port>].
Scheme can be ldap or ldaps in the format (port optional).
address.title: address

birthdate.description: The attribute holding the birthdate of the user.
birthdate.title: birthdate

country.description: The attribute holding the country of the user.
country.title: country

display_name.description: The attribute holding the display name of the user. This will be used to greet an authenticated user.
display_name.title: display_name

distinguished_name.description: The attribute holding the distinguished name of the user.
distinguished_name.title: distinguished_name

family_name.description: The attribute holding the family name of the user.
family_name.title: family_name

gender.description: The attribute holding the gender of the user.
gender.title: gender

given_name.description: The attribute holding the given name of the user.
given_name.title: given_name

group_name.description: The attribute holding the name of the group.
group_name.title: group_name

locale.description: The attribute holding the locale of the user.
locale.title: locale

locality.description: The attribute holding the locality of the user.
locality.title: locality

mail.description:
The attribute holding the mail address of the user. If multiple email addresses are defined for a user, only the
first one returned by the LDAP server is used.
mail.title: mail

member_of.description: The attribute which represents the objects this user is a member of.
member_of.title: member_of

middle_name.description: The attribute holding the middle name of the user.
middle_name.title: middle_name

nickname.description: The attribute holding the nickname of the user.
nickname.title: nickname

phone_extension.description: The attribute holding the phone extension of the user.
phone_extension.title: phone_extension

phone_number.description: The attribute holding the phone number of the user.
phone_number.title: phone_number

picture.description: The attribute holding the picture URL of the user.
picture.title: picture

postal_code.description: The attribute holding the postal code of the user.
postal_code.title: postal_code

profile.description: The attribute holding the profile of the user.
profile.title: profile

region.description: The attribute holding the region of the user.
region.title: region

street_address.description: The attribute holding the street address of the user.
street_address.title: street_address

username.description:
The attribute holding the username of the user. This attribute is used to populate the username in the session
information.
username.title: username

website.description: The attribute holding the website of the user.
website.title: website

zoneinfo.description: The attribute holding the zoneinfo of the user.
zoneinfo.title: zoneinfo

base_dn.description: The base dn for every LDAP query.
base_dn.title: base_dn

groups_filter.description: The groups filter used in search queries to find the groups of the user.
groups_filter.title: groups_filter

implementation.description: The LDAP implementation, this affects elements like the attribute utilised for resetting a password.
implementation.title: implementation

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

permit_feature_detection_failure.description:
This option is strongly discouraged. If enabled it will ignore errors looking up the RootDSE for supported
controls/extensions.
permit_feature_detection_failure.title: permit_feature_detection_failure

permit_referrals.description:
Follow referrals returned by the server.
This is especially useful for environments where read-only servers exist. Only implemented for write operations.
permit_referrals.title: permit_referrals

permit_unauthenticated_bind.description:
Permits use of an unauthenticated bind. WARNING: This option is strongly discouraged. Please consider
disabling unauthenticated binding to your LDAP server and utilizing a service account.
permit_unauthenticated_bind.title: permit_unauthenticated_bind

count.description: The number of open connections to be available in the pool at any given time.
count.title: count

retries.description:
The number of attempts to obtain a free connecting that are made within the timeout period. This
effectively splits the timeout into chunks.
retries.title: retries

timeout.description:
The amount of time that we wait for a connection to become free in the pool before giving up and failing
with an error.
timeout.title: timeout

start_tls.description: Use StartTLS with the LDAP connection.
start_tls.title: start_tls

maximum_version.description: Maximum TLS version for the connection.
maximum_version.title: maximum_version

minimum_version.description: Minimum TLS version for the connection.
minimum_version.title: minimum_version

server_name.description:
The server subject name to check the servers certificate against during the validation process.
This option is not required if the certificate has a SAN which matches the host portion of the url option.
server_name.title: server_name

skip_verify.description: Skip verifying the server certificate entirely.
skip_verify.title: skip_verify

user.description: The username of the admin user.
user.title: user

users_filter.description: The users filter used in search queries to find the user profile based on input filled in login form.
users_filter.title: users_filter

disable.description: Disable both the HTML element and the API for change password functionality.
disable.title: disable

custom_url.description:
External reset password url that redirects the user to an external reset portal. This disables the internal
reset functionality.
custom_url.title: custom_url

disable.description: Disable both the HTML element and the API for reset password functionality.
disable.title: disable

refresh_interval.description: The amount of time to wait before we refresh data from the authentication backend. Uses duration notation.
refresh_interval.title: refresh_interval

default_2fa_method.description:
Set the default 2FA method for new users and for when a user has a preferred method configured that has been
disabled. This setting must be a method that is enabled.
Options are totp, webauthn, mobile_push.
default_2fa_method.title: default_2fa_method

network.description: The network section configures named network lists.
network.title: network

user_attributes.description:
The user attributes section allows you to define custom attributes for your users using Common Expression
Language (CEL).
user_attributes.title: user_attributes

disabled.description:
Disable the configMap source for the Authelia config. If this is false you need to provide a volumeMount via
PV/PVC or other means that mounts to /config.
disabled.title: disabled

enable_self_enrollment.description: Enables Duo device self-enrollment from within the Authelia portal.
enable_self_enrollment.title: enable_self_enrollment

hostname.description: The Duo API hostname. This is provided in the Duo dashboard.
hostname.title: hostname

integration_key.description: The non-secret Duo integration key. Similar to a client identifier. This is provided in the Duo dashboard.
integration_key.title: integration_key

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

existingConfigMap.description: The name of an existing ConfigMap instead of generating one.
existingConfigMap.title: existingConfigMap

extraConfigs.description: The paths of extra configs that are mounted into the Pod which should be used.
extraConfigs.title: extraConfigs

disabled.description: Disables the template filters. This is not recommended.
disabled.title: disabled

claims_policies.description:
The claims policies are policies which allow customizing the behavior of claims and the available claims for
a particular client.
claims_policies.title: claims_policies

clients.description: List of registered clients for this provider.
clients.title: clients

allowed_origins.description:
List of allowed origins.
Any origin with https is permitted unless this option is configured or the
allowed_origins_from_client_redirect_uris option is enabled.
allowed_origins.title: allowed_origins

allowed_origins_from_client_redirect_uri.description:
Automatically adds the origin portion of all redirect URI's on all clients to the list of allowed_origins,
provided they have the scheme http or https and do not have the hostname of localhost.
allowed_origins_from_client_redirect_uri.title: allowed_origins_from_client_redirect_uris

endpoints.description: List of endpoints in addition to the metadata endpoints to permit cross-origin requests on.
endpoints.title: endpoints

discovery_signed_response_alg.description: The JSON Web Algorithm used for signing the discovery metadata.
discovery_signed_response_alg.title: discovery_signed_response_alg

discovery_signed_response_key_id.description: The JSON Web Key ID used for signing the discovery metadata.
discovery_signed_response_key_id.title: discovery_signed_response_key_id

enable_client_debug_messages.description:
Enables additional debug messages. SECURITY NOTICE: It's not recommended to use this in production as it
may leak configuration information to clients.
enable_client_debug_messages.title: enable_client_debug_messages

enable_jwt_access_token_stateless_intros.description: Enables introspecting JWT Profile Access Tokens using stateless checks. This is strongly discouraged.
enable_jwt_access_token_stateless_intros.title: enable_jwt_access_token_stateless_introspection

enable_pkce_plain_challenge.description: Enables the plain PKCE challenge which is not recommended for security reasons but may be necessary for some clients.
enable_pkce_plain_challenge.title: enable_pkce_plain_challenge

enabled.description:
Enables this in the config map. Currently in beta stage.
See https://www.authelia.com/r/openid-connect/
enabled.title: enabled

enforce_pkce.description:
Adjusts the PKCE enforcement. Options are always, public_clients_only, never.
For security reasons it's recommended this option is public_clients_only or always, however always is not
compatible with all clients.
enforce_pkce.title: enforce_pkce

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

jwks.description:
The JWK's issuer option configures multiple JSON Web Keys. It's required that at least one of the JWK's
configured has the RS256 algorithm. For RSA keys (RS or PS) the minimum is a 2048 bit key.
jwks.title: jwks

custom.description:
The custom lifespan configuration allows customizing the lifespans per-client. The custom lifespans must be
utilized with the client lifespan option which applies those settings to that client. Custom lifespans can be
configured in a very granular way, either solely by the token type, or by the token type for each grant type.
custom.title: custom

minimum_parameter_entropy.description:
Adjusts the parameter entropy requirements for nonce/state etc. SECURITY NOTICE: It's not recommended changing
this option, and highly discouraged to have it less than 8.
minimum_parameter_entropy.title: minimum_parameter_entropy

context_lifespan.description: Adjusts the lifespan for a Pushed Authorization session / context.
context_lifespan.title: context_lifespan

enforce.description: Requires Pushed Authorization Requests for all Authorization Flows.
enforce.title: enforce

require_pushed_authorization_requests.description: Enables requiring all Authorization Requests to be initiated using a Pushed Authorization Request.
require_pushed_authorization_requests.title: require_pushed_authorization_requests

scopes.description: A list of scope definitions available in addition to the standard ones.
scopes.title: scopes

elevated_session.description:
# The Elevated Session Identity Validation implementation ensures that users cannot perform actions which may
# adjust the security characteristics of their account without first ensuring the user is adequately identified.
# The settings below therefore can affect the level of security Authelia provides to your users so they should be
# carefully considered.

characters.description:
The number of characters the random One-Time Code has. Maximum value is currently 20, but we recommend keeping
it between 8 and 12. Itâ€™s strongly discouraged to reduce it below 8.
characters.title: characters

code_lifespan.description: The lifespan of the randomly generated One Time Code after which itâ€™s considered invalid.
code_lifespan.title: code_lifespan

elevation_lifespan.description: The lifespan of the elevation after initially validating the One-Time Code before it expires.
elevation_lifespan.title: elevation_lifespan

require_second_factor.description:
Requires second factor authentication for all protected actions in addition to the elevated session provided
the user has configured a second factor authentication method.
require_second_factor.title: require_second_factor

skip_second_factor.description:
Skips the elevated session requirement if the user has performed second factor authentication. Can be combined
with the require_second_factor option to always (and only) require second factor authentication.
skip_second_factor.title: skip_second_factor

elevated_session.title: elevated_session

reset_password.description:
The Reset Password Identity Validation implementation ensures that users cannot perform a reset password flow
without first ensuring the user is adequately identified. The settings below therefore can affect the level of
security Authelia provides to your users so they should be carefully considered.

jwt_algorithm.description: The JSON Web Token Algorithm used to sign the JWT. Must be HS256, HS384, or HS512.
jwt_algorithm.title: jwt_algorithm

jwt_lifespan.description: The lifespan of the JSON Web Token after itâ€™s initially generated after which itâ€™s considered invalid.
jwt_lifespan.title: jwt_lifespan

secret.description: # The secret used with the HMAC algorithm to sign the JWT minted by Authelia.

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

secret.title: secret

reset_password.title: reset_password

key.description: The key from the ConfigMap manifest to generate and mount the configuration.
key.title: key

labels.description: Extra labels for the ConfigMap manifest.
labels.title: labels

file_path.description: File path where the logs will be written. If not set logs are written to stdout.
file_path.title: file_path

format.description: Format the logs are written as: json, text.
format.title: format

level.description: Level of verbosity for logs: info, debug, trace.
level.title: level

disable_startup_check.description: You can disable the notifier startup check by setting this to true.
disable_startup_check.title: disable_startup_check

filename.description: The file to add email text to. If it doesnâ€™t exist it will be created.
filename.title: filename

address.description:
Configures the address for the SMTP Server. The address itself is a connector and the scheme must be smtp,
submission, or submissions. The only difference between these schemes are the default ports and submissions
requires a TLS transport per SMTP Ports Security Measures, whereas submission and smtp use a standard TCP
transport and typically enforce StartTLS.
address.title: address

disable_require_tls.description: By default we require some form of TLS. This disables this check though is not advised.
disable_require_tls.title: disable_require_tls

disable_starttls.description:
Some SMTP servers ignore SMTP specifications and claim to support STARTTLS when they in fact do not. For
security reasons Authelia refuses to send messages to these servers. This option disables this measure and is
enabled AT YOUR OWN RISK.
disable_starttls.title: disable_starttls

identifier.description: HELO/EHLO Identifier. Some SMTP Servers may reject the default of localhost.
identifier.title: identifier

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

sender.description:
The sender is used to construct both the SMTP command MAIL FROM and to add the FROM header. This address must
be in RFC5322 format.
sender.title: sender

startup_check_address.description:
This address is used during the startup check to verify the email configuration is correct.
It's not important what it is except if your email server only allows local delivery.
startup_check_address.title: startup_check_address

subject.description:
Subject configuration of the emails sent.
{title} is replaced by the text from the notifier
subject.title: subject

maximum_version.description: Maximum TLS version for the connection.
maximum_version.title: maximum_version

minimum_version.description: Minimum TLS version for the connection.
minimum_version.title: minimum_version

server_name.description:
The server subject name to check the servers certificate against during the validation process.
This option is not required if the certificate has a SAN which matches the host option.
server_name.title: server_name

skip_verify.description: Skip verifying the server certificate entirely.
skip_verify.title: skip_verify

username.description: The username sent for authentication with the SMTP server. Paired with the password.
username.title: username

disable_failure.description:
The default of false will prevent startup only if we can contact the NTP server and the time is out of sync with
the NTP server more than the configured max_desync. If you set this to true, an error will be logged but startup
will continue regardless of results.
disable_failure.title: disable_failure

disable_startup_check.description:
Disables the NTP check on startup entirely. This means Authelia will not contact a remote service at all if you
set this to true, and can operate in a truly offline mode.
disable_startup_check.title: disable_startup_check

max_desync.description: Maximum allowed time offset between the host and the NTP server.
max_desync.title: max_desync

max_length.description: Require a maximum length for passwords.
max_length.title: max_length

min_length.description: Require a minimum length for passwords.
min_length.title: min_length

zxcvbn.description: # zxcvbn is a well known and used password strength algorithm. It does not have tunable settings.
zxcvbn.title: zxcvbn

ban_time.description:
The length of time before a banned user can login again. Ban Time accepts duration notation.
See: https://www.authelia.com/configuration/prologue/common/#duration-notation-format
ban_time.title: ban_time

find_time.description:
The time range during which the user can attempt login before being banned. The user is banned if the
authentication failed 'max_retries' times in a 'find_time' window. Find Time accepts duration notation.
See: https://www.authelia.com/configuration/prologue/common/#duration-notation-format
find_time.title: find_time

max_retries.description: The number of failed login attempts before user is banned. Set it to 0 to disable regulation.
max_retries.title: max_retries

modes.description:
The regulation modes to use. The active modes determines what is banned in the event of a regulation ban being
triggered as well as what logs to inspect to determine if a ban is needed. Default is just user, but ip is also
available.
modes.title: modes

asset_path.description: Set the path on disk to Authelia assets. Useful to allow overriding of specific static assets.
asset_path.title: asset_path

authz.description: Dictionary of individually configured Authz endpoints.
authz.title: authz

automatic_authz_implementations.description:
A list of automatically configured authz implementations if you don't wish to manually configure each one.
Important Note: If you configure the 'authz' section this is completely ignored.
automatic_authz_implementations.title: automatic_authz_implementations

csp_template.description:
Read the Authelia docs before setting this advanced option.
https://www.authelia.com/configuration/miscellaneous/server/#csp_template.
csp_template.title: csp_template

path.description: Set the single level path Authelia listens on.  Must be alphanumeric chars and should not contain any slashes.
path.title: path

port.description:
Port sets the configured port for the daemon, service, and the probes. Default is 9091 and should not need
to be changed.
port.title: port

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

expiration.description: The time before the cookie expires and session is reset.
expiration.title: expiration

inactivity.description: The inactivity time before the session is reset.
inactivity.title: inactivity

name.description: The name of the session cookie. (default: authelia_session).
name.title: name

database_index.description: This is the Redis DB Index https://redis.io/commands/select (sometimes referred to as database number, DB, etc).
database_index.title: database_index

high_availability.description:
# The Redis HA configuration options.
# This provides specific options to Redis Sentinel, sentinel_name must be defined (Master Name).

enabled.description: Enable the use of redis sentinel.
enabled.title: enabled

nodes.description:
The additional nodes to pre-seed the redis provider with (for sentinel).
If the host in the above section is defined, it will be combined with this list to connect to sentinel.
For high availability to be used you must have either defined; the host above or at least one node below.
nodes.title: nodes

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

route_by_latency.description: Choose the host with the lowest latency.
route_by_latency.title: route_by_latency

username.description:
The Redis Sentinel-specific username. If supplied, authentication will be done via Redis 6+ ACL-based
authentication. If left blank, authentication to sentinels will be done via `requirepass`.
username.title: username

high_availability.title: high_availability

host.description:
The redis host or unix socket path. If utilising an IPv6 literal address it must be enclosed by square
brackets and quoted.
host.title: host

maximum_active_connections.description: The maximum number of concurrent active connections to Redis.
maximum_active_connections.title: maximum_active_connections

minimum_idle_connections.description: The target number of idle connections to have open ready for work. Useful when opening connections is slow.
minimum_idle_connections.title: minimum_idle_connections

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
(string) The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

port.description: The port redis is listening on.
port.title: port

tls.description: # The Redis TLS configuration. If defined will require a TLS connection to the Redis instance(s).

maximum_version.description: Maximum TLS version for the connection.
maximum_version.title: maximum_version

minimum_version.description: Minimum TLS version for the connection.
minimum_version.title: minimum_version

server_name.description:
The server subject name to check the servers certificate against during the validation process.
This option is not required if the certificate has a SAN which matches the host option.
server_name.title: server_name

skip_verify.description: Skip verifying the server certificate entirely.
skip_verify.title: skip_verify

tls.title: tls

username.description: Optional username to be used with authentication.
username.title: username

same_site.description:
Sets the Cookie SameSite value. Possible options are none, lax, or strict.
Please read https://www.authelia.com/configuration/session/introduction/#same_site
same_site.title: same_site

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

address.description:
Configures the address for the MySQL/MariaDB Server. The address itself is a connector and the scheme must
either be the unix scheme or one of the tcp schemes.
address.title: address

database.description: The database name on the database server that the assigned user has access to for the purpose of Authelia.
database.title: database

disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

maximum_version.description: Maximum TLS version for the connection.
maximum_version.title: maximum_version

minimum_version.description: Minimum TLS version for the connection.
minimum_version.title: minimum_version

server_name.description:
The server subject name to check the servers certificate against during the validation process.
This option is not required if the certificate has a SAN which matches the host option.
server_name.title: server_name

skip_verify.description: Skip verifying the server certificate entirely.
skip_verify.title: skip_verify

username.description: The username paired with the password used to connect to the database.
username.title: username

address.description:
Configures the address for the PostgreSQL Server. The address itself is a connector and the scheme must
either be the unix scheme or one of the tcp schemes.
address.title: address

database.description: The database name on the database server that the assigned user has access to for the purpose of Authelia.
database.title: database

disabled.description: Disables this secret and leaves configuring it entirely up to you.
disabled.title: disabled

path.description:
The path to the secret. If it has a '/' prefix it's assumed to be an absolute path within the pod. Otherwise
it uses the format '{mountPath}/{secret_name}/{path}' where '{mountPath}' refers to the 'secret.mountPath'
value, '{secret_name}' is the secret_name above, and '{path}' is this value.
path.title: path

secret_name.description:
The secret name. The ~ name is special as it is the secret we generate either automatically or via the
secret_value option below.
secret_name.title: secret_name

value.description: The value of a generated secret when using the ~ secret_name.
value.title: value

schema.description:
The database schema name to use on the database server that the assigned user has access to for the purpose
of Authelia. By default this is the public schema.
schema.title: schema

servers.description:
This specifies a list of additional fallback PostgreSQL instances to use should issues occur with the primary
instance which is configured with the address and tls options.
servers.title: servers

maximum_version.description: Maximum TLS version for the connection.
maximum_version.title: maximum_version

minimum_version.description: Minimum TLS version for the connection.
minimum_version.title: minimum_version

server_name.description:
The server subject name to check the servers certificate against during the validation process.
This option is not required if the certificate has a SAN which matches the host option.
server_name.title: server_name

skip_verify.description: Skip verifying the server certificate entirely.
skip_verify.title: skip_verify

username.description: The username paired with the password used to connect to the database.
username.title: username

port.description: The port to listen on for metrics. This should be on a different port to the main server.port value.
port.title: port

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the ServiceMonitor manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

labels.description: Extra labels for the ServiceMonitor manifest.
labels.title: labels

theme.description: Theme name to use for the frontend.
theme.title: theme

algorithm.description:
The TOTP algorithm to use.
It is CRITICAL you read the documentation before changing this option:
https://www.authelia.com/configuration/second-factor/time-based-one-time-password/#algorithm
algorithm.title: algorithm

allowed_algorithms.description:
Similar to algorithm with the same restrictions except this option allows users to pick from this list. This list
will always contain the value configured in the algorithm option.
allowed_algorithms.title: allowed_algorithms

allowed_digits.description:
Similar to digits with the same restrictions except this option allows users to pick from this list. This list
will always contain the value configured in the digits option.
allowed_digits.title: allowed_digits

allowed_periods.description:
Similar to period with the same restrictions except this option allows users to pick from this list. This list
will always contain the value configured in the period option.
allowed_periods.title: allowed_periods

digits.description:
The number of digits a user has to input. Must either be 6 or 8.
Changing this option only affects newly generated TOTP configurations.
It is CRITICAL you read the documentation before changing this option:
https://www.authelia.com/configuration/second-factor/time-based-one-time-password/#digits
digits.title: digits

issuer.description:
The issuer name displayed in the Authenticator application of your choice.
Defaults to 'Authelia'.
issuer.title: issuer

period.description:
The period in seconds a one-time password is valid for.
Changing this option only affects newly generated TOTP configurations.
period.title: period

secret_size.description: The size of the generated shared secrets. Default is 32 and is sufficient in most use cases, minimum is 20.
secret_size.title: secret_size

skew.description:
The skew controls number of one-time passwords either side of the current one that are valid.
Warning: before changing skew read the docs link below.
See: https://www.authelia.com/configuration/second-factor/time-based-one-time-password/#input-validation to read the documentation.
skew.title: skew

attestation_conveyance_preference.description:
Conveyance preference controls if we collect the attestation statement including the AAGUID from the device.
Options are none, indirect, direct.
attestation_conveyance_preference.title: attestation_conveyance_preference

display_name.description: The display name the browser should show the user for when using Webauthn to login/register.
display_name.title: display_name

permitted_aaguids.description:
A list of Authenticator Attestation GUIDâ€™s that are the only ones allowed to be registered. Useful if you have
a company policy that requires certain authenticators. Mutually exclusive with prohibited_aaguids.
permitted_aaguids.title: permitted_aaguids

prohibit_backup_eligibility.description:
Setting this value to true will ensure Authenticators which can export credentials will not be able to
register. This will likely prevent synchronized credentials from being registered.
prohibit_backup_eligibility.title: prohibit_backup_eligibility

prohibited_aaguids.description:
A list of Authenticator Attestation GUIDâ€™s that users will not be able to register. Useful if company policy
prevents certain authenticators. Mutually exclusive with permitted_aaguids.
prohibited_aaguids.title: prohibited_aaguids

cache_policy.description: Allows adjusting the WebAuthn Metadata Cache Policy.
cache_policy.title: cache_policy

enabled.description:
Enables metadata service validation of authenticators and credentials. This requires the download of the
metadata service blob which will utilize about 5MB of data in your configured storage backend.
enabled.title: enabled

validate_entry.description:
Enables validation that an entry exists for the authenticator in the MDS3 blob. Itâ€™s recommended that this
option is the default value, however this may exclude some authenticators which DO NOT have FIDO compliance
certification or have otherwise not registered with the MDS3. The recommendation is based on the fact that the
authenticity of a particular authenticator cannot be validated without this.
validate_entry.title: validate_entry

validate_entry_permit_zero_aaguid.description:
Allows authenticators which have provided an empty Authenticator Attestation GUID. This may be required for
certain authenticators which DO NOT have FIDO compliance certification.
validate_entry_permit_zero_aaguid.title: validate_entry_permit_zero_aaguid

validate_status.description:
Enables validation of the attestation entry statuses. There is generally never a reason to disable this as the
authenticators excluded by default are likely compromised.
validate_status.title: validate_status

validate_status_permitted.description: A list of exclusively required statuses for an authenticator to pass validation.
validate_status_permitted.title: validate_status_permitted

validate_status_prohibited.description: A list of authenticator statuses which for an authenticator that are prohibited from being registered.
validate_status_prohibited.title: validate_status_prohibited

validate_trust_anchor.description:
Enables validation of the attestation certificate against the Certificate Authority certificate in the
validated MDS3 blob. Itâ€™s recommended this value is always the default value.
validate_trust_anchor.title: validate_trust_anchor

attachment.description: Sets the attachment preference for newly created credentials.
attachment.title: attachment

discoverability.description: Sets the discoverability preference. May affect the creation of Passkeys.
discoverability.title: discoverability

timeout.description: Adjust the interaction timeout for Webauthn dialogues.
timeout.title: timeout

enabled.description: This field can be used as a condition when authelia is a dependency. This definition is only a placeholder and not used directly by this chart. See https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/dependencies/#conditions-and-tags for more info
enabled.title: enabled

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

pullPolicy.description: The pull policy for the standard image.
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

repository.description: The repository location on the registry.
repository.title: repository

tag.description: The tag to use from the registry.
tag.title: tag

annotations.description: Extra annotations for ingress related manifests.
annotations.title: annotations

className.description: Ingress Class Name for the Ingress manifests.
className.title: className

enabled.description: Enable Gateway API HTTP Route generation.
enabled.title: enabled

hostnamesOverride.description: Override the hostnames for the HTTPRoute manifest.
hostnamesOverride.title: hostnamesOverride

parentRefs.description: Configure the parent references for the HTTPRoute manifest.
parentRefs.title: parentRefs

labels.description: Extra labels for ingress related manifests.
labels.title: labels

rulesOverride.description: Override to the rules values for the Ingress type manifest.
rulesOverride.title: rulesOverride

apiGroupOverride.description: The apiGroupOverride overrides the first part of the apiVersion for TraefikCRD manifests.
apiGroupOverride.title: apiGroupOverride

apiVersionOverride.description: The apiVersionOverride overrides the second part of the apiVersion for TraefikCRD manifests.
apiVersionOverride.title: apiVersionOverride

disableIngressRoute.description: Use a standard Ingress object, not an IngressRoute.
disableIngressRoute.title: disableIngressRoute

enabled.description: Enable generating the Traefik 3.x CRD Middleware etc manifests.
enabled.title: enabled

entryPoints.description: Defines the valid entryPoints to route for the IngressRoute.
entryPoints.title: entryPoints

authResponseHeaders.description: Defines the ForwardAuth Middleware Auth Response Headers.
authResponseHeaders.title: authResponseHeaders

endpointOverride.description: Overrides the endpoint used for the middleware. This is the portion of the endpoint after '/api/authz/'.
endpointOverride.title: endpointOverride

after.description: List of Middlewares to apply after the forwardAuth Middleware in the authentication chain.
after.title: after

before.description: List of Middlewares to apply before the forwardAuth Middleware in the authentication chain.
before.title: before

after.description: List of Middlewares to apply after the middleware in the IngressRoute chain.
after.title: after

before.description: List of Middlewares to apply before the middleware in the IngressRoute chain.
before.title: before

priority.description: Defines the rule priority for the IngressRoute.
priority.title: priority

responseForwardingFlushInterval.description: Defines the Response Forwarding Flush Interval for the IngressRoute.
responseForwardingFlushInterval.title: responseForwardingFlushInterval

sticky.description: Defines the sticky value for the IngressRoute.
sticky.title: sticky

stickyCookieNameOverride.description: Overrides the default sticky cookie name for the IngressRoute.
stickyCookieNameOverride.title: stickyCookieNameOverride

certResolver.description: Name of the Certificate Resolver to use.
certResolver.title: certResolver

disableTLSOptions.description: Disables inclusion of the IngressRoute TLSOptions.
disableTLSOptions.title: disableTLSOptions

domainsOverride.description: Override the domains values for TLS operations.
domainsOverride.title: domainsOverride

weight.description: Defines the service weight for the IngressRoute.
weight.title: weight

kubeDNSDomainOverride.description: Kubernetes DNS Domain Override allows forcibly overriding the default DNS Domain for Kubernetes 'cluster.local'.
kubeDNSDomainOverride.title: kubeDNSDomainOverride

kubeVersionOverride.description:
Kubernetes Version Override allows forcibly overriding the detected KubeVersion for fallback capabilities
assessment. The fallback capabilities assessment only occurs if the APIVersions Capabilities list does not include a
known # APIVersion for a manifest which occurs with some CI/CD tooling. This value will completely override the value
detected by helm.
kubeVersionOverride.title: kubeVersionOverride

labels.description:
Extra labels for all generated resources. Most manifest types have a more specific labels value
associated with them.
labels.title: labels

mariadb.description:

This will be deployed when storage.mysql.deploy is set to true
Currently settings need to be manually copied from here to the storage.mysql section
For more options and to see the
mariadb.title: mariadb

nameOverride.description: (string) The name override for this deployment.
nameOverride.title: nameOverride

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the NetworkPolicy manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

labels.description: Extra labels for the NetworkPolicy manifest.
labels.title: labels

policyTypes.description: The Policy Types such as Ingress or Egress.
policyTypes.title: policyTypes

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the PersistentVolumeClaim related manifests.
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: Enable the PersistentVolumeClaim features for Authelia.
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description: Extra annotations for the PersistentVolumeClaim related manifests.
labels.title: labels

mountPropagation.description: Sets the mount propagation value for the PersistentVolumeClaim.
mountPropagation.title: mountPropagation

readOnly.description: Mounts the PersistentVolumeClaim in read-only mode.
readOnly.title: readOnly

storageClass.description: Uses the specified storageClass for the PersistentVolumeClaim.
storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description: Mounts specifically a subpath of the PersistentVolumeClaim.
subPath.title: subPath

subPathExpr.description: Uses an expression to mount a subpath of the PersistentVolumeClaim.
subPathExpr.title: subPathExpr

volumeName.description:
Persistent Volume Name. Useful if Persistent Volumes have been provisioned in advance and you want to use a
specific one.
volumeName.title: volumeName

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the Pod spec.
annotations.title: annotations

args.description: Modifies the args for the command. Useful for debugging.
args.title: args

annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: Enable the HorizontalPodAutoscaler which requires the in cluster metrics server.
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description: Extra labels for the HorizontalPodAutoscaler manifest.
labels.title: labels

command.description: Modifies the command. Useful for debugging.
command.title: command

disableRestartOnChanges.description:
Normally when a change is detected via helm install to something that only indirectly affects the pod, the pod
will restart. This setting allows disabling this behavior.
disableRestartOnChanges.title: disableRestartOnChanges

env.description: List of additional environment variables for the Pod.
env.title: env

extraContainers.description: Extra containers to add to the Pod spec.
extraContainers.title: extraContainers

initContainers.description: The list of custom initialization containers.
initContainers.title: initContainers

kind.description: The Pod Kind to use. Must be Deployment, DaemonSet, or StatefulSet.
kind.title: kind

labels.description: Extra labels for the Pod spec.
labels.title: labels

priorityClassName.description: The priority class name for the Pod spec.
priorityClassName.title: priorityClassName

replicas.description: The number of replicas if relevant.
replicas.title: replicas

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the PodDisruptionBudget manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

labels.description: Extra labels for the PodDisruptionBudget manifest.
labels.title: labels

maxUnavailable.description: Maximum available value for the PodDisruptionBudget manifest.
maxUnavailable.title: maxUnavailable

minAvailable.description: Minimum available value for the PodDisruptionBudget manifest.
minAvailable.title: minAvailable

Configure postgresql database subchart under this key.
This will be deployed when storage.postgres.deploy is set to true
Currently settings need to be manually copied from here to the storage.postgres section
For more options and to see the
postgresql.title: postgresql

annotations.description: Extra annotations for RBAC related manifests.
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: Enable RBAC. Turning this on associates Authelia with a service account.
enabled.title: enabled

labels.title: labels

serviceAccountName.description: Kubernetes service account name to generate.
serviceAccountName.title: serviceAccountName

additionalSecrets.description: Additional secrets to mount to the Pod.
additionalSecrets.title: additionalSecrets

annotations.description: Extra annotations for the Secret manifest.
annotations.title: annotations

existingSecret.description: Name of an existing Secret manifest to mount instead of generating one.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

labels.description: Extra labels for the Secret manifest.
labels.title: labels

mountPath.description: Pod path to mount the values of the Secret manifest.
mountPath.title: mountPath

clusterIP.description: (string) Cluster IP for the Authelia service manifest.
clusterIP.title: clusterIP

externalTrafficPolicy.description: (string) Use value Local to get external IP addresses.
externalTrafficPolicy.title: externalTrafficPolicy

nodePort.description: Node Port for the Authelia service manifest.

versionOverride.description:
Version Override allows changing some chart characteristics that render only on specific versions.
This does NOT affect the image used, please see the below image section instead for this.
If this value is not specified, it's assumed the appVersion of the chart is the version.
The format of this value  is x.x.x, for example 4.100.0. Minimum value is 4.38.0, and support is not guaranteed.
versionOverride.title: versionOverride
